ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: none.
0 hrs
The amount of time it took for the seminar to happen....?
The seminar required minimal participation each week. Basically, an hour per week.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: A few lectures were good, but most were not. Kelly Brownell's was definitely the highlight of the course.
learned a lot about current research

Strengths: wide range of topicsWeaknesses: most topics were not relevant to my interests or focus, seemed to be primarily a seminar for CDE and not SBS, the course time schedule conflicted with many meetings which were required for internships
N/A
The CDE seminar series keeps improving.Thanks for bringing in such excellent speakers on such a wide array of current and highly relevant chronic-disease topics.
We don't learn anything. Too much glossing over random topics. This should not be mandatory.
These seminars are incoveniently timed and make it difficult for me to balance Mondays. However, some topics were interesting, though not extraordinary.
Course did better this semester bringing in outside researchers and covering a more diverse set of topics. Still room for improvement.
I liked the 2nd semester seminar better. It might have been a combination of the speakers, but all of them were extremely good and thought provoking.
I enjoyed the CDE/SBS seminar much more this semester than last semester. It was probably because more of the topics were things that I am interested in, but I felt that it was worth my time.
Interesting to hear about the research that's currently going on, sometimes boring, sometimes the lecturers weren't great.
The seminars were interesting.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Josephine Hoh  Did not even know who the instructor was.
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  speakers were good! most talks were very interesting
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  Hardly saw her this semester
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  There is no instructor
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  She was rarely at the seminars.
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  This class was speakers, so I am unsure how to evaluate one. I thought all of them were great.
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  The instructor invited interesting speakers who were very encouraging toward students' asking questions at the end of each session.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Mandatory, so you can't get out of it. Not really helpful or pertinent for the most part.
seminars are interesting and provide good exposure to public health issues and research
The course is required, so just get it over with
Must for CDE/SBS
The CDE seminar series keeps improving.Thanks for bringing in such excellent speakers on such a wide array of current and highly relevant chronic-disease topics.
You probably won't have a choice but if i were you i wouldnt take it
Just an information sesssion that may conflict with schedules.

The seminars are really fascinating. It is such a wonderful opportunity to learn about the research communities here at Yale and other places; and I felt I gained new perspectives on many of the topics that were discussed.

This is a required seminar for all first year students, but it was definitely interesting to learn about the research faculty members are working on in our field of interest. I would recommend this course to another student.
Required course. Bring lunch.
Weekly seminars during which various researchers present their latest findings followed by a brief question and answers period.
